reviewText: We enjoyed watching Billy: The Early Years of Billy Graham.  The young Billy was appealing and charming and funny and real. What God did and is doing through his life is amazing and teaches all of us that with faith and conviction a simple life can have world-wide and eternal impact.  The movie was a good depiction of that.
I saw this in the theater in October 2008, yes 2008. That's 18 months of waiting for this to come out on DVD and FINALLY it's here! Great movie and I will definitely be buying it!

I, too bought this beautiful movie at my local Wal*Mart for just $9.00!  I sure got my money's worth, even though there is no sermon included, as was promised. That was a big disappointment!

I have Billy Graham's biography in book form so I knew about his early years. Still, it was fun to watch on the screen. The acting was wonderful! I had never heard of most of these actors so I was very surprised at how good they all were. Martin Landau, Jennifer O'Neil, and Lindsey Wagner were great, as always.

Billy Graham, the man, is a true blessing to all Christians and even non-Christians the world over and it's about time a movie about him was made. I just hope the rest of his life will be covered through film someday. And I hope it's not too far ahead!

In this day and age when it's so difficult to find something the entire family can watch, Billy, The Early Years is a gem to stumble across. In fact, I am going to be taking my DVD copy to church for a Family Movie Night real soon.

Thank you, Alice Kane
You can get this DVD at walmart for $9.  I don't know why they are charging that much for this dvd.  If they want to sell any, beat walmarts price.

I have to admit that I hadn't gotten this through Amazon, but from the local WallMart here in New Jersey.  A friend of mine had pointed out to me thay had it on their shelves and I had quickly bought it and we watched it not long after getting home.  One of the things I was greatly interested in see after the film was the 2009 sermon that was said to have been included as one of the special features.  You can imagine my disappointment when I checked the special features section and the only things listed were a behind-the-scenes, and a trailer.  What happened?  I was going to get a copy of this film for a friend's father who is a great fan of Mr. Graham.  He would have been ecstatic to know there would have been a sermon on the dvd.  I'm glad I had checked the special features before sending him out a copy.

If you are a fan of Billy Graham and don't care if there's a sermon of his included, then buy this movie.  Run, don't walk to get it.  You won't be sorry you did.  If you're hoping for some inspirational words spoken by Billy himself in a taped sermon... then don't bother.  Box says it's there, but it isn't.
Never knew his story!!
loved the movie very informative into Dr. Billy Grahams life.
Excellent movie! It seemed as though a lot (too much) editing was done for Martin Landaus part. I kept feeling like I had missed something important. But I thoroughly enjoyed everything with Billy!
Great movie
Nice to see the very human struggles, especially early, of someone I greatly admire.

Wonderful movie! The characters were believable and the story line was nothing short of a miracle. Highly recommend. For families: one spot in the movie was a little sensitive sexually. We really need to raise the bar when it comes to Christian movies. "We are not to look upon these things". The scene didn't need to be so graphic even though it was "clouded". You either walk the walk or sit down and well...

Otherwise lots of laughs, times of tears, and a must watch again and again movie! It will take a spot next to my Kendrick Bros. movies :)
Inspiring and informative.
Nice movie

Outstanding movie and music with lots of heart.  Armie Hammer is outstanding as a young Billy Graham.  Saw the movie in theaters with my dad when it came out, and loved it then.  As I watched this video the first time, it gave me goosebumps as the music and movie started .. and I remembered why I loved it.  It touches your heart.  Brooks and Dunn with Mac Powell give a moving rendition in the opening sequence of the Johnny Cash penned "Over the Next Hill We'll Be Home."  A sweet, funny, touching movie, and beautiful telling of the early life of Billy Graham.

Are you kidding me? If this is truly how Billy Graham was in his twenties and thirties (and I seriously doubt it), then he wasn't so special. But again, I doubt it. Much of the movie was spent trying to present the topic in a humorous way, but it wasn't funny. It came off campy and just weird. I think this is just a case of a great topic presented very poorly. Perhaps one day we'll get a good movie about Billy Graham, but this definitely was not it.

"God's Ambassador" - Billy Graham, this is a great movie that gives insight into how God orchestrated the events in this young man's life that he would go on to live out his calling in ministry and set many people on the path to seek God through learning about the heart of Jesus. Billy Graham, selfless and obedient, a faithful servant of God.
Graham is my hero!  This is a wonderful movie.
very enlightening
Very good movie it was better then I thought it would be
Excellent movie
Great movie about how he got started.
Movie was very good.  Exactly as we thought it would be.
great
My mom & I really enjoyed this movie.
Great story.
Good deal!!

This was a delightful insightful story of Billy Graham showing how his spiritual journey was filled with humor and wisdom.  Just the ticket to learning about how God picks and uses his servants to his purpose!
yes very good
A very unheard story and enjoyable.
A good movie for the whole family to watch if child is 11 and older.
Excellent!
Great movie!
Well, this isn't a great movie, but if you are interested in Mr Graham's early years, you might enjoy it.
Great Service...Excellent Product!
Love this movie. Wholesome and very romantic and inspiring!
I Recommend this movie. Billy Graham is a wonderful man and preacher.

Loved this movie! I wish it would have continued. Mr. Graham's steps have been ordered by the Lord and he walked in them. So sad to see the part about his friend Chuck Templeton.  As far as anyone knows, he never made it right between himself and the Lord even after he lived for Christ a short time.
Great story about the early years of one of the nations beloved pastors.
Excellent
Excellent Christian movie.
I really liked this movie
This is a great DVD! I would highly recommend it for all ages !!

Great DVD,enjoyed it very much. The music was wonderful. The downside,if their is one,it wasn't long enough,I hope there is a second DVD of his Rev. Billy's middle and latter years of his life serving God,and witnessing Jesus As our savior.
Great movie!

I loved it.  I have read one of his Bio books and this movie let us see how he started out as a young man and how he fail into his purpose when he wasn't even looking for it at the time,  his mind was on baseball not evangelism.  The movie also reflected that God showed favor on Billy's life.  Each elevation that Billy received God qualified him not man. The movie have several areas that each of us could relate to in living our own lives.  It is a good movie for newly called preachers to see, so they can see that every person that is called to preach the Word of God is different, but you will never forget how it happen and when.  The truth is what God has for you, it is for you and no one can stop it.  It maybe delayed but not stopped.
Love it
My aunt asked me to order this for her friend. However, my 93 year old aunt read it first, and she told me she couldn't put it down. She said she would recommend for any 'senior'.

Loved it! Excellent acting by all! Our 15-year old son enjoyed it.  Yes, we cannot be sure how much is accurate but we can research that.  As far as enjoying a wholesome movie and one that may pique interest in learning more about Billy Graham, evangelism, or God, this was worth every penny! Armie portrayed Billy perfectly, loved the beauty, purity, and character shown in his relationship with Ruth!
Great movie
Great Inspiration!!! Took a lot of Life tips from this movie
super

Not a very good "Christian" movie. This movie is more about the Templeton's view of Billy's life. Templeton was an Atheist. That being said, I would not recommend this title to anyone who is looking for an uplifting movie. I loved how Billy sought God around the end and had a filling of the Holy Spirit experience. Overall though, this was a blowout...
Inspiring! A great American used by God to reach the world.
This is an excellent DVD about the beginning of Biily Graham's ministry.

LOVED IT !!!
YOU'LL LOVE IT TOO -- If you love Billy Graham ..
Good story line .. cute guy, whoever plays the young Billy !  Thank You GOD for Mr. Graham !
Great Soundtrack -- some REAL GOOD country songs, one by Alan Jackson ..
AGAIN,  YOU'LL LOVE IT !
Great movie about Billy Graham, an awesome man of God.
Love this movie.
good movie
A must see.
I loved this DVD.  Fascinating story well acted
I bought this as a gift and the receiver was so happy and surprised. This dvd has over 6 hours of video clips. Great dvd for the Billy Graham flock.
Wonderful movie!!!!!!

I do not know if this was one of Armie Hammer's first roles or not, but his portrayal of Billy Graham is wonderful. This film vividly portrays the importance of faith and that choices matter by contrasting Graham's decisions versus those of his fellow colleague Charles Templeton. Cameo roles by Josh Turner and Scott Hamilton are entertaining as well. If you have any affinity and respect for Billy Graham, you will not be disappointed with this film. I only wish it was available on Blu Ray.
Billy: The Early Years of Billy Graham was a good look into how God brought Billy to where he was.
A life that inspires
great movie
I thought it was precious! I love Billy Graham even more after watching this! I showed it to my teenagers and they even liked it!

I have seen Billy Graham (in his elder years) so it was great to see how he became the greatest Evangelist of my time.  It was fun to see his conversion from an athlete to a man after God's own heart.  I can not imagine what it will be like for him to meet Jesus in heaven.....what a wonderful thought.  And to think of all the people that he will meet that will tell him "Thank You" for leading them to Christ and changing their lives.  Praise our LORD.
love billy graham and his mighty words for the saving of your life as he narrates his own and how he became who he is today...a must see

I just gave the wrong review to CRUSADE-The Life of Billy Graham.  Sorry, the titles were so much a like. This film of Rev. Graham's was very interesting.  I had wondered how he became an Evangelist, now I know what happened to turn him to the Lord.  I only wish the movie would have gone even farther into his life with detail to his wife and family.

THIS WAS AN GOOD CHRISTIAN FAMILY MOVIE. MY HUSBAND AND I REALLY ENJOYED THE MOVIE.IT HAD SOME COMICAL MOMENTS IN THE MOVIE AS TO WHEN BILLY WAS TRYING TO BECOME AN MINISTER. I RECOMEND OTHERS TO BUY AND WATCH THE MOVIE. YOU WILL ENJOY IT.
What an inspiring movie. It gives a variety of performances. Lindsay Wagner was so believable. I bought several for Christmas gifts. Without exception I have been thanked repeatedly.

I felt it was a very real view of his life how he also went through times of questioning God while trying to find his purpose and identity. A very good balance of humor and real life situations. I highly recommend it.
This was an amazing movie, the theology is correct. It's a moving film, it was great to learn about the life of Billy Graham.

This is a great movie for family viewing. I wish that it would have had a sermon with it, but it is well made movie. You will not go wrong with this movie. We will enjoy it for years to come. We showed it at a movie night at our church and everyone said it was one of the best movies they had seen.

I chose Billy The Early Years of Billy Graham because I like Billy Graham he has lived  life as an example of Jesus. He walks the walk of Jesus and tells the truth because he tells it from the Bible which is truth. I would recommend this book to anyone that likes Billy Graham and his life.

If your faith needs a shot in the arm, this should do it. The movie was nothing I expected it to be - all syrupy and sugar-coated. After all, it is about Billy Graham and I thought I knew just about everything there is to know about him. Surprisingly, I was so absorbed I had to sit up to watch it and my mouth even flew wide open a couple of times. I shook my head and wept as it made me desire to please God as much as Billy. I've always had the highest respect for Dr. Graham. Real God-fearing men of the cloth like him who are not tainted by worldliness nor full of themselves and puffed up with pride are a rarity these days. He never sent out mixed signals as he humbly walked the talk, nor did he veer from the true message of the Gospel according to the way it's written in the New Testament. What a testimony. Great job all around to all involved.

I will never forget what Billy Graham's pianist of many years, Tedd Smith, said about him in the early 1970s: Wherever Billy Graham was, whomever he was with, at home or while traveling, even when it was "just the guys," he was always the same--the most consistent Christian-mannered person Mr. Smith had ever known. I was a counselor at a Billy Graham crusade while on staff with a Christian organization in the San Francisco Bay Area, and my organization's president sat on the platform during the crusade and got acquainted with the team. Mr. Smith told him what a consistent Christian the Rev. Graham had been over the years, and later my president relayed this to us staff members. I remember hearing elsewhere about Billy Graham being the best-liked person in the United States, having influence with Presidents, so I was glad to get this DVD about the early years of this historical figure. It's very good and inspiring.
Gave a personal view of the evangelist, Billy Graham from his teen years through his early years as a famous evangelist.

I loved his story of conversion and early actions.  He was here one time on a crusade and I got to go to it and I was greatly strengthened in my new faith.  I had only recently been converted and baptized but the thousands of people he called who came give me goose bumps now, years later.  WOW!!!
Was very please to add this movie to my watching times. As a teen I was a counselor for children.  This movie brought back wonderful memories
Excellent movie which I am well pleased with and very enlightening in the early years of Billy Graham.  I would highly recommend this film for the entire family and friends.
Very good movie.  Wish it had gone further into his life, but then it is "Billy the early years".  Great testimony!

This is a really well done movie.  I think Robbie Benson did a great job as director.  Very funny at times and also sad at other times.

I ordered this copy for my pastor.

Actor who portrays young Billy is much handsomer than the real Billy and the story has a marvelous clean quality that is a joy to experience.  Whatever your belief, this is an inspiring film of the beautiful youth of a great world evangelist.

I enjoyed the era, the theme, and the reminder of the amazing lady Ruth Bell Graham was. I was very disappointed that Templeton's anti-Biblical views were given such air time. This was supposed to be a film in honor of Ruth Bell Graham. She would be saddened to know that her God was dishonored so vehemently with Templeton's angry, strong contempt during his conversation with Billy. The point of their parting ways could have been handled less intensely for a film trying to uplift the God of the Bible Whom Billy and Ruth dearly love and have given their whole lives to honor and exalt.

This is a wonderful movie on so many different levels.  In many ways it is the story of two men, Billy Graham and Charles Templeton, and highlights the consequences that each man has as a result of his faith choices. Providing a contrast between the two men's lives made the main message all the more meaningful. One of its strengths is that it does not water down the faith elements and beautifully presents Billy Graham's call to the ministry.  The balance of faith, humour, romance, and dealing with real issues, makes for a very well-rounded film.  One of the strong messages of the movie is that God will never leave or forsake us, and it encourages people to come to true faith in Jesus Christ through its accurate portrayal of the Gospel message.

First of all it is well acted by the entire cast from major to minor characters. Armie Hammer portrays Billy Graham brilliantly and is careful not to overplay the role.  He is also an actor with impeccable comedic timing and this adds to the story as well by presenting Billy as just a regular fellow with a calling to preach the Gospel. The only weakness is with the portrayal of his mixed, and rather complex, accent. However, Armie's presentation of Billy as a man, and not as a spiritual icon, is really well done.  Lindsay Wagner plays his mother and also has a standout performance.  I was surprised to see Scott Hamilton, the figure skater, in a minor role.  He does a good job as well!  I also like Cliff Bemis' performance as Dr. Ham and Kristoffer Polaha as the younger Charles Templeton.

*Spoiler Paragraph:  Part of the story is told through an aging Charles Templeton, who talks to news reporters about his friendship with Billy Graham from his hospital bed.  He also mentions his own spiritual conversion and as an aging man seems to have regrets about his life choices.  The real Charles reported seeing angels and said he missed Jesus before he died.  In the film, it shows Charles' journey and how he falls into unbelief as a younger man.  He becomes disillusioned after the war as he can't understand why God allows such horrible things to happen to innocent people, and he also begins to doubt the Divine inspiration of Scripture.  I find the scenes with Billy Graham's conversion at a Dr. Mordecai Ham crusade and the spiritual climax in the film to be extremely moving and well done.  The romance between Billy & Ruth is very sweet.  Although it may not have happened exactly like that, it makes for a good story and is respectful of both of them.*

Reactions from the Graham family have been mixed. Billy Graham's oldest daughter, Gigi, and Ruth Bell Graham's sister have both said that they love the film, and I have to say that their characters are both in the film as well. Apparently Ruth Bell Graham never threw a baseball? However, to me this is small potatoes and not at all what the film is about. I feel the screenwriter was just trying to connect Billy's love for baseball at the beginning of the film, with an activity that many couples do together. She was a strong woman and this was nicely presented in this way. The scene when Bob Jones tells Billy he will not amount to anything, which was the one thing that apparently caused some embarrassment for the Graham family, was not included on the dvd. However, Billy Graham mentions the occurrence in his auto-biography himself, so perhaps sometimes the truth is harder to take than fiction. My feeling is that the Graham family could come out with a more accurate biographical film, but I for one will keep coming back to this charming film. Its sweetness, and moving portrayal of Billy's calling to preach the Gospel and his Faith to believe the Bible as the inspired Word of God, will always make it a favourite of mine.

It was so good that another one of our church groups will be having a potluck and showing the movie..
The acting and story line was superb.
I was unaware of Billy Graham's early years.  This movie shows how fast your heart can turn to God and how much passion you can have for God.
I have always been a follower of Rev. Billy Graham.  I had never known of how he became an Evangelist.  What a wonderful glimpse into the life of a Great man.
good actors, well done Billy graham has my respect and admiration and this is a good disc to have for his "fans"

This is the true story of young Billy Graham.
He had no desire or intentions to become
a preacher and look at the final outcome.
Great story.
Excellent family movie. This one is a keeper, for sure. Would recommend for all ages. Hope you all will enjoy as much as we did.
Billy Graham is a name known all over the world.  Yet he is just an ordinary man who yielded his life to God.  Its a great story.

We feel that this DVD (movie) was OK but it does not portray the real earfly years of his ministry. It is more of a hodge-podge of his activities prior to his crusades and fame as an Evangelist. We are not sure of its authenticity.

This was a very good family movie about Billy Graham and how he got Gods call and truly embraced it! I watched it with my three and four year old who loved it too. If you buy this movie I promise it will be a great addition to your collection.
I enjoy any movie that is positive, uplifting-this is. Thank you for this DVD!. Funny,touching,intense. You will laugh & cry when you see this movie.
This was a movie I saw on a preview and it seemed to be so interesting that I wanted to see the entire movie and it has been a life provoking movie for me.  It by far exceeded my expectations.
What good is a Spanish subtitle if you only speak English and are hearing impaired!  My mother-in-law is sooooo disappointed!

Today, almost everyone has heard of Billy Graham, but not everybody knows his early history--or "the rest of the story", as Paul Harvey liked to say.  This DVD tells the rest of that story, and it was very interesting.

The narrative begins with Billy Graham as a young man living at his parent's home, and how he came to be called into the ministry.  We also learn about the person he almost married, and the one he did--and how he met her.  We see how one of Billy Graham's very best friends in the ministry lets him down, and then ridicules him publicly.  It is very easy to identify with Billy Graham in the different situations portrayed.

This movie definitely keeps your interest, some parts are funny and some are sad.  Even if Billy Graham were not a public figure, this would be an account worth watching.  Even though there were not any big name actors in this film, it was well done and enjoyable.  I am a long-time admirer of Dr. Graham, and came forward at one of his crusades when I was twelve years old.  Learning Dr. Graham's history made me respect him even more.

The movie is suitable for all ages and clean.  Our family highly recommends this, and gives it five stars.

That movie is great, you can see to a man like you but deciding to give his life to Jesus Christ and proclaim the gospel to every nation. In this time is very important to take this example and apply it, live it.
This movie was very well done and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I would highly recommend this movie to anyone who appreciates this amazing evangelist.
This is a very informative  movie of the early years of Billy Graham's life.  It is a nice addition to my video library.
After reading comments from Billy Graham's staff,this was not approved by him. A lot of this was untrue and being a fan of his and interested in this story,that made me feel like I wasted my money .
Bought this as a present for my husband who was very pleased with it. We both enjoyed the movie as well as it's content.

This has been one of the most inspirational and also enjoyable films I've seen, how God can openly use the life of a young man who has his life open to God. Armie Hammer does a fantastic job of portraying a young farm boy who believes God wants him to preach; along the way he stumbles yet grows while learning how to preach.  One of the finest scenes for me was him preaching to a passing crowd while only one man responds, 'no one wants anything to do with me' and Billy says "God does", and embraces the black man pouring out his heart.  Then the wonderful scenes of a nervous lovestruck college student hopelessly falling for Ruth, who becomes his one and only the rest of her life.  So many other poignant scenes with Charles Templeton, becoming youngest president of a Bible college, and ending with his famous 1949 Los Angeles Tent Crusade (which both of my parents attended).  This is fraught with emotion, laughter, tears, and all because of love for God who first loved us.  A wonderful film I'd recommend to anyone!!
saw reviews for this movie and Looked interesting and bought it Defintely worth the time if you like family movies.
Who knows how true to the facts this is, but the DVD is interesting.  Would like to see a sequel

I just watched this today and was surprised to discover that the story was presented (sort of) through the eyes of a dying Charles Templeton. I appreciated that Billy was unafraid of the truth, but at the same time not trying to prove something to someone who is unable to understand or accept faith. It was enough for him and it's enough for any person who humbly seeks God. The story spanned the years up to the first crusade in Los Angeles in 1949 and being only about 90 minutes, could not go into a lot of detail but it was still enjoyable. I was sorry that the film is only closed captioned or subtitled in Spanish. What about all the (almost) deaf people who speak English?
Wonderful movie, it gives you insight into the life of a great man of God. This was purchased from Amazon.Billy: The Early Years Of Billy Graham
I don't know much about Billy Graham to be honest, I was just looking for a good Christ-centered movie. But this is not that. Mostly about men and not at all about God.

I was hoping to see a good biographical potrait of a great American evangelist, yet if there was any way to make the preaching of the gospel more campy (or in some cases creepy) I don't know how they'd do it.  In their alleged attempts to do Billy Graham justice, it felt more like they were running the gospel through the mud; there seemed no grasp of its power, rather it seemed to be a group of unsaved thespians attempting to accurately portray something they know nothing about.
If you're interested in learning about Billy Graham stick with His autobiography 'Just as I am,' its a bit of a long read, but has excellent historical value, as well as actually doing justice to the man's work

Love this movie! Rented it and liked it so much I got online the next day and bought it! But I would caution parents, there are
one or two swear words and several disturbing images. It is a wonderful movie for older kids and adults,though!

"..."Billy: The Early Years" does something that most Christian films are too afraid to do: raise some tough questions that agnostics and atheists typically ask when discussing religion and spirituality. My hat's off to the filmmakers for handling all of these elements so well." -Lance; Cruciflicks Co-Founder

"...watching "Billy: The Early Years" was as educational for me as it was entertaining." -Mary; Cruciflicks Co-Founder

For the rest of our reviews on this and other faith based films, check out cruciflicks.net where "We don't judge people, just the movies they make."

I bought this movie at my local Lifeway Christian Bookstore and watched it that very same evening.  Much to my delight it is an excellent movie.  The story of Billy Graham's early years is told through the eyes of Dr. Templeton, a friend turned harsh critic of Billy Graham's.  He is being interviewed in the nursing home and the actor portraying him is most convincing.  As the story goes, Billy Graham aspired to be a baseball player.  His family had a dairy farm so while not starving during The Great Depression as many were, they weren't a gilded age family either.  He goes to a revival led by Dr. Ham and feels drawn to a higher calling of serving The Lord.  The actor portraying Billy does a good job of being the young love struck fellow.  And the romantic story is a sweet one.  Incidentally, I didn't know Ruth Bell Graham had a little bit of a feminist streak in her until this movie.  That was neat to discover!  We are led through the story of how Templeton hits his crisis in Faith and Billy hits a stumbling block in preaching The Word.  But eventually he realizes that Faith is the key and his evangelizing soars.  The actor portrayed the preaching a little bit more animated in nature than I've heard Billy Graham do.  But then I don't know much about his early years.  In the end, the movie leaves one wanting to watch more, it is that good of a film.  There is only one swear word in the movie and other than that, it is a very clean and family friendly motion picture.

"Billy: The Early Years" is a wonderful movie about the childhood and the call to the ministry of Dr. Billy Graham. The producer has accomplished a great work to inform the millions of viewers who always wanted to know how this ministry began. The movie is a delight to view.

Love the man , his example and this movie. This culture and way of life has always been under attack from without and within. I think the flags on the moon are a testimony to the  christian nation we once were. These people who loved the Lord were the core of the 1000 year leap.
I don't really have the words to say but it is God moving movie. I recommend this for all to watch .. AWESOME !!!
This was an awesome movie. It was delivered quickly and with no problems.  That is why I always buy from Amazon.

This movie had a good cast and a pretty good message. You don't expect the ending and it feels like the movie ends to soon but, over all it's an excellent movie. It is encouraging to see someone overcome and see them stand strong for God in the midst of so many obstacles.

Background:

William Franklin "Billy" Graham, Jr.  was born on November 7, 1918 to William Franklin Graham I (1888-1962) and Morrow Coffey (1892-1981). He grew up on a dairy farm near Charlotte, North Carolina. He was raised in the Associate Reformed Presbyterian Church. However, it was only when he attended a series of revival meetings in Charlotte which were led by evangelist Mordecai Ham in 1934 that he truly accepted the Lord Jesus Christ as his personal Lord and Savior. He was 16 years old.

He attended Sharon High School until May 1936. He then went attended Bob Jones College (Tennesse) for one semester before transferring to the Florida Bible Institute in 1937. It was here that he received his calling to preach the Gospel. Subsequently in 1943, Graham graduated from Wheaton College in Wheaton, Illinois with a degree in anthropology. In August of that year he also married his classmate Ruth Bell (1920-2007). They had five children together. While attending this college, he became pastor of the United Gospel Tabernacle and also had other preaching engagements.

Storyline/Presentation:

This movie is unfolded by the recollections of Billy Graham's early mentor in the ministry, Charles Templeton (Martin Landau). These two men became very good friends as they ministered the Word together. However, at the end of World War II, as Templeton views the images of the Holocaust, his faith in God starts to diminish. Hence as Graham starts to be more well recognized and established, Templeton, turns his back on his flock and takes up a secular position instead.

This film obviously, is not your typical 'white wash' Christian movie, but it delves into the heart of man, and their frailties. No punches are held back, in doing so, we begin to comprehend how some ministers of the Gospel fail and do not finish their race successfully.

Conclusion:

This film appears to be a true reflection of the early years of Billy Graham, however, without some background information you may find it difficult to follow the story along. I feel that the producers could have lenghtened the film a bit so that the reasons for his college transitions could have been presented more clearly.

My wife and I optimistically watched this film with the hopes of it being spiritually up lifting.  In my opinion the film reflects Christianity in a negative light and more emphasis was given to doubts in Christ than placing faith in Christ.  I believe the intent of the film is to place a seed of doubt in the person watching it "above all else guard your heart because it is the wellspring of life".

Wow, awesome movie!  My husband and I watched this movie last night and it was really good.  My husband read the book and he said it was just like the book but the book was longer. If I knew it was at wal-mart for $9 I would have bought it there.

This account of Billy Graham's life is very honest (it showed him like he was), moving and convicting.  The producers have done a good job portraying him as a human being, like all of us, who yielded to God and allowed Him to use him.  Terrific movie!!!
Rented this movie and liked it so much that I bought it so that I can show it to others.
Good
I love this story of Billy Graham's beginning years.  I have watched several times and given several copies as gifts.  Everyone has enjoyed it.
This is a must see for every Christian...aside from being a beautiful love story...it shows Billy Graham's faith walk in a way that will encourage you!

At first, I thought this was a really terrific film, so I bought it.
Then I watched it again and realized that the film spends more time trying to make Billy Graham into a comical figure and give Charles Templeton's point of view as an agnostic.
Only one REAL heartening moment is when Billy Graham was preaching in a poverty district and he and a black man connected. That was the best in the film.

This was a truly great movie.  It's always good to see that we don't start out perfect but we do strive for perfection!  Seeing how Billy started out and to know how great his ministry was is truly inspiring!
The product is really great! The seller is really great too! Keep up the great work! Don't change a thing.
